descriptionNullable:
The data for this airline reviews dataset was collected by web scraping the website https://www.airlinequality.com/ using the Python library Beautiful Soup. The website serves as a platform for travelers to submit their reviews and ratings about different airlines. By parsing the HTML content of the website, relevant information such as airline names, ratings, review titles, dates, and other attributes were extracted. The collected data was then processed and organized into a structured dataset, where each row represents a single airline review and each column represents a specific review attribute. Adherence to data privacy and website terms of use was ensured throughout the collection process. This transparent methodology allows others to understand the data's origin and how it was obtained, facilitating further analysis and research.


Here's how I scrapped the data: https://www.kaggle.com/khushipitroda/airline-review-scrapping/

Task List for Data Analysis, Machine Learning, and NLP on Airline Reviews Dataset:

**1.Data Preprocessing:**
   - Handle missing values and duplicates.
   - Convert date formats to a standard format.
   - Clean and tokenize text data for NLP tasks.
   - Perform feature engineering if needed (e.g., extract airline features, sentiment scores).

**2.Exploratory Data Analysis (EDA):**
   - Visualize overall rating distribution of airlines.
   - Analyze sentiment distribution in reviews.
   - Explore correlations between different review attributes.
   - Investigate the most reviewed airlines and routes.
   - Study the relationship between recommended status and ratings.

**3.Sentiment Analysis:**
   - Perform sentiment analysis on review text to determine positive/negative sentiment.
   - Compare sentiment scores with overall ratings to understand alignment.

**4.Machine Learning - Predicting Overall Rating:**
   - Split the dataset into training and testing sets.
   - Select appropriate features and encode categorical variables.
   - Build a machine learning model to predict overall ratings based on other attributes.
   - Evaluate the model's performance using metrics like RMSE or R2.

**5.Machine Learning - Recommender System:**
   - Create a recommendation engine to suggest airlines based on user preferences.
   - Utilize collaborative filtering or content-based filtering approaches.
   - Evaluate the recommendation system's accuracy and coverage.

**6.Natural Language Processing (NLP):**
   - Perform topic modeling to identify common themes in reviews.
   - Implement text summarization techniques to create condensed review summaries.
   - Extract key phrases and sentiment from reviews using NLP tools.
   - Apply named entity recognition (NER) to identify airline names, locations, etc.

**7.Pointwise Analysis:**
   - Analyze individual review attributes (e.g., seat comfort, cabin staff service, food & beverages) to identify trends and patterns.
   - Compare different airlines and aircraft types based on specific attributes.
   - Visualize pointwise ratings to highlight strengths and weaknesses of airlines.

**8.Time-based Analysis:**
   - Analyze how airline ratings and sentiments change over time.
   - Identify any seasonality or trends in customer feedback.

**9.Word Clouds and Visualizations:**
   - Create word clouds to visualize frequently mentioned words in positive and negative reviews.
   - Generate interactive visualizations to present insights effectively.

**10.Text Generation (Optional - Advanced NLP):**
   - Experiment with text generation models to generate synthetic airline reviews.
   - Assess the quality and coherence of generated reviews.

Remember to adjust the task list based on the specific objectives of your analysis and the requirements of the dataset.
title: SkyRatings: Unleashing 23K+ Airline Reviews!
subtitle: "SkyRatings: Unleashing 23K+ Airline Reviews!"
description:
The data for this airline reviews dataset was collected by web scraping the website https://www.airlinequality.com/ using the Python library Beautiful Soup. The website serves as a platform for travelers to submit their reviews and ratings about different airlines. By parsing the HTML content of the website, relevant information such as airline names, ratings, review titles, dates, and other attributes were extracted. The collected data was then processed and organized into a structured dataset, where each row represents a single airline review and each column represents a specific review attribute. Adherence to data privacy and website terms of use was ensured throughout the collection process. This transparent methodology allows others to understand the data's origin and how it was obtained, facilitating further analysis and research.


Here's how I scrapped the data: https://www.kaggle.com/khushipitroda/airline-review-scrapping/
